critique: The document is an amendment to Regulation No. 7, issued by the White House in 1936. It defines student-aid projects and sets limits on the amount of aid disbursed to students at different levels of education (primary, high school, college, and graduate school). The amendment is based on the Emergency Relief Appropriation Act of 1935.The document reflects a moderate interventionist approach to economic regulation, as it involves the government in providing financial assistance to students. It doesn't directly address immigration, executive power, federalism, security vs. liberty, or social inclusion. Therefore, these aspects are considered neutral.
